organic_results.title: The impact of instruction and external events on student orientations and opinion consistency concerning the Vietnam war
organic_results.snippet: International relations instruction had much less impact than external events during the spring of 1968 in changing student opinions on the Vietnam war. Identical questionnaires were administered at the beginning and end of the semester to the classes of two international relations professors at Purdue University, one somewhat sympathetic to and the other quite critical of US Administration policies concerning Vietnam. Control classes in sociology and psychology were also employed. Although international relations instruction …
